meanings.definition: To act as a substitute or replacement for someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: She surrogated her friend in the school play when her friend got sick.
meanings.sent2: The teacher surrogated the class hamster over the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The cat surrogated as a lion in the school play, wearing a mane and roaring loudly.
meanings.sent4: His old car surrogated as a spaceship in his imagination, zooming through the galaxy.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella surrogated as a shield in the pretend battle, protecting him from imaginary foes.

meanings.definition: To appoint someone as a surrogate.
meanings.sent1: He surrogated his sister to take care of his plants while he was away.
meanings.sent2: The manager surrogated a team member to represent the department at the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear was surrogated as the king of the stuffed animal kingdom by the little girl.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl was surrogated as the leader of the forest creatures, guiding them with its knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The toy soldier was surrogated as the captain of the army of toys, leading them into battle.

meanings.definition: To transfer or delegate authority or responsibility to another person.
meanings.sent1: The manager surrogated the decision-making power to his assistant for the day.
meanings.sent2: She surrogated the task of organizing the event to her best friend.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand was surrogated as the ruler of the enchanted kingdom, granting wishes to all.
meanings.sent4: The key surrogated as the gatekeeper, unlocking the mysteries of the ancient castle.
meanings.sent5: The crown surrogated as the symbol of power, bestowing authority upon the chosen ruler.
